channel.description: Recent content in 14. Expressing Preferences – Talking about Likes, Dislikes, and Preferences on Italiano con Geoff

item.title: Lesson 14.1: What Do You Like? – Using 'Mi piace' and Friends
item.description: Learn how to say what you like and don’t like in Italian — from coffee to chaos, with Geoff and Viktor as your guides.

item.title: Exercise 14.1: Practice – What Do You Like?
item.description: Practice expressing likes and dislikes in Italian. Warning: May cause sudden cravings for gelato.

item.title: Lesson 14.2: I Prefer This One – Using 'Preferire' in Italian
item.description: Learn how to say what you prefer in Italian — whether it’s pizza over pasta, or silence over accordion solos.

item.title: Exercise 14.2: Practice – What Do You Prefer?
item.description: Practice using ‘preferire’ to choose between pizza, pasta, and peace and quiet. No judgment.

item.title: Lesson 14.3: Love It, Hate It – Talking About Strong Preferences
item.description: Use ‘amare’, ‘odiare’, and emotional expressions to talk about what you truly love (or can’t stand), featuring Geoff, Viktor, and a very questionable soup.

item.title: Exercise 14.3: Practice – Love It or Hate It?
item.description: Practice using ‘amare’ and ‘odiare’ to talk about things you love, hate, or feel strangely passionate about (like cabbage soup).
